entries.title: Brazilian authorities brace for possible repeat of uprising
entries.description: Brazilian authorities took preventive measures to secure the country's capital after a call to action circulated online promoting a “mega-protest to retake power”.

entries.title: 'These days are really dark to me:' Taliban bans continue to erode women's rights
entries.description: The Taliban's recent ban on women from attending universities paints a stark contrast to how the country operated before the U.S. military's withdrawal in 2021. NBC News' Dasha Burns interviews one anonymous Afghan girl who said the bans have worsened women's rights and education.

entries.title: Woman sprays 'holy water' on gay couple outside Mexico church
entries.description: A gay couple hugging in front of a church in Mexico was sprayed with what appeared to be "holy water" by a woman who accused them of spreading immorality to

entries.title: Putin replaces commander of Russia’s war in Ukraine after just 3 months
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has appointed a new commander to lead his forces in Ukraine.  Gen.

entries.title: Church of England says it knew of slavery links as fund set up to address ‘shameful’ past
entries.description: The Church of England knew it was investing in the transatlantic slave trade during the 18th century, the head of its investment arm said on Wednesday, after

entries.title: U.K. police investigating uranium-tainted cargo at Heathrow
entries.description: British counterterrorism police are investigating after border officers seized cargo contaminated with uranium at London’s Heathrow Airport.

entries.title: Police start clearing German village condemned for coal mine
entries.description: Police in riot gear on Wednesday moved into a condemned village in western Germany, launching an effort to evict activists holed up at the site in an attempt

entries.title: Police begin to clear climate change activists from German village earmarked for demolition
entries.description: Police entered a condemned village in western Germany to evict activists holed up at the site in an effort to prevent its demolition to make way for the expansion of a coal mine.

entries.title: Cubans weigh options on migration to U.S. after new Biden border rules
entries.description: Cubans frantic to escape economic crisis at home weighed options on how to move to the U.S. after the Biden administration rolled out new immigration rules.

entries.title: Flights across the U.S. grounded after FAA experiences computer outage
entries.description: Flights across the United States were grounded Wednesday morning after the Federal Aviation Administration said it experienced a computer outage.

entries.title: Uganda’s latest Ebola outbreak is over, WHO and officials say
entries.description: Uganda’s latest outbreak of the Ebola virus is over. Uganda’s government and the World Health Organization made the announcement Wednesday.

entries.title: 6 stabbed in Paris train station, attacker shot by police
entries.description: A knife attacker wounded six people in an unprovoked attack in the Gare du Nord train station in central Paris on Wednesday morning before being shot by police, the French interior minister said.

entries.title: Ukraine's Zelenskyy praises support from 'free world' at Golden Globes
entries.description: During a video appearance at the 80th Golden Globe awards, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said his country will stop Russia's invasion but warned that there are "still battles and tears ahead."

entries.title: Tributes for Australian Cardinal George Pell who has died age 81
entries.description: Archbishop Pell died on Tuesday at the age of 81 from heart complications following hip surgery. He was acquitted of sexual abuse convictions by an Australian appeals court in 2020 after spending 13 months in prison.

entries.title: International tensions rise over China’s Covid outbreak
entries.description: China has stopped issuing short-term visas in South Korea and Japan in response to restrictions on its travelers amid a Covid-19 outbreak.

entries.title: Several hurt in Paris station attack; attacker 'neutralized'
entries.description: An individual injured several people at the Gare du Nord train station in Paris on Wednesday morning, French Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said in a tweet.

entries.title: Brazilian judge orders arrest of Bolsonaro’s ex-minister after Brasilia rampage
entries.description: A Brazilian Supreme Court judge ordered the arrest of Anderson Torres, who was Bolsonaro’s justice minister before taking over as public security chief for Brasilia.

entries.title: Prince Harry's memoir 'Spare' hits shelves
entries.description: Prince Harry’s long-awaited memoir “Spare” finally hit shelves after weeks of leaked stories and speculation. NBC’s Keir Simmons has the details on even more of the book's startling revelations.

entries.title: Australian Cardinal George Pell, whose conviction was overturned, dies at 81
entries.description: Cardinal George Pell, who was the most senior Catholic cleric to be convicted of child sex abuse before his convictions were later overturned, has died in Rom
